metadata.title: CVE-2024-26749 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: usb:cdns3: fixed memory use after free at cdns3_gadget_ep_disable() ...cdns3_gadget_ep_free_request(&priv_ep->endpoint, &priv_req->request);list_del_init(&priv_req->list); ... 'priv_req' actually free atcdns3_gadget_ep_free_request(). But list_del_init() use priv_req->listafter it. [ 1542.642868][ T534] BUG: KFENCE: use-after-free read in__list_del_entry_valid+0x10/0xd4 [ 1542.642868][ T534] [ 1542.653162][T534] Use-after-free read at 0x000000009ed0ba99 (in kfence-#3): [1542.660311][ T534] __list_del_entry_valid+0x10/0xd4 [ 1542.665375][ T534]cdns3_gadget_ep_disable+0x1f8/0x388 [cdns3] [ 1542.671571][ T534]usb_ep_disable+0x44/0xe4 [ 1542.675948][ T534]ffs_func_eps_disable+0x64/0xc8 [ 1542.680839][ T534]ffs_func_set_alt+0x74/0x368 [ 1542.685478][ T534]ffs_func_disable+0x18/0x28 Move list_del_init() beforecdns3_gadget_ep_free_request() to resolve this problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
